sub_title: Responsible Fashion Innovator & Strategist | Circular Economy | Fashion Management | Lecturer
summary: Hello! I am Marit√©, an industrial engineer from Chile with a background in fashion/textiles business, sustainability, and circular economy. I  graduated from the London College of Fashion MBA program in 2019. I am part of the teaching team of the Master in Innovative Textile Development at Saxion University in the Netherlands. I am also a Fashion Revolution volunteer since 2016. I volunteer with the Chilean and Dutch teams.

volunteer_experiences:
[{'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'role': 'Volunteer', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Fashion Revolution', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQHI50M8df7SLg/company-logo_400_400/0/1539782341243?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=64-Mkp1UM0oiUCOy_bPokI7rG8lOkNBEH_VJC3ucq1Q', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/fashion-revolution/'}, 'cause': 'HUMAN_RIGHTS', 'description': 'On 24 April 2013, the Rana Plaza building in Bangladesh collapsed. 1,138 people died and another 2,500 were injured, making it the fourth largest industrial disaster in history. That‚Äôs when Fashion Revolution was born. There were five garment factories in Rana Plaza all manufacturing clothing for big global brands. The victims were mostly young women.

I have helped with translations from English to Spanish for the Chilean team. In the UK, I organised events as a student ambassador at UAL, attended multiple activities in London and got involved with several online campaigns to spread the word.'}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'role': 'Volunteer', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Forest Recycling Project FRP', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQEcrHRBxO2yjg/company-logo_400_400/0/1567389907717?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=AQOVOgo3xWqyXlSV6-ouW8eIzLm3LaKPGSB1vct-IfA', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/forest-recycling-project-frp/'}, 'cause': 'ENVIRONMENT', 'description': 'Forest Recycling Project (FRP) is a social enterprise and charity with environmental and social aims located in Walthamstow, London.
I participated in a workshop to make a jacket with reclaimed fabrics collected by FRP. I learned to do the pattern cutting and to sew a reversible jacket for a child. The jacket was donated to the charity Baby Bank.'}]
